bug.author: joshgreifer
bug.summary: cuda tensor parameter fail to convert to numpy in InternalTorchIRGraph
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
If the input parameter type to a traced model is tensor.cuda(), ct.convert fails with the below error Torch
<denchmark-h:h2>Trace</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code> File "/home/josh/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/mil/frontend/torch/internal_graph.py", line 180, in __init__ value = param.detach().numpy() TypeError: can't convert cuda:0 device type tensor to numpy. Use Tensor.cpu() to copy the tensor to host memory first.
</denchmark-code>
Note, possible fix: replace value = param.detach().numpy() with value = param.cpu().detach().numpy() <denchmark-h:h2>System environment (please complete the following information):</denchmark-h>
coremltools version: 4.0b1 OS: Linux How you install python: anaconda python version: 3.7.6
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Add any other context about the problem here.
